resources.string: Sign in to access the options below:
No Instances Found. Press Menu and click Refresh.
No Apps Found. Press Menu and click Refresh.
Name of the Image: Please limit the name to 15 characters

Description of the Image: 
 This text will appear in Atmosphere's user interface.
 It should concisely describe the tools installed,
 their purpose (e.g. "This image performs X analysis"),
 and intent of the VM (e.g. "designed for XYZ workshop")
List installed software: \n List any software that you have installed\n Include paths to the executables if they are not found in (/usr/bin) or (/usr/local/bin).
Unmount EBS Volumes: \n If you have an EBS volume mounted, please unmount it or enter the mount point.
iPlant-managed System Files: \n If your VM image requires a change in an iPlant-managed system, list changes and why they are necessary.
Image Tags: \n Atmosphere supports tags for searching;\n List relevant tags for this VM image.

Image Visibility:
 VM images can be made visible to you, a select group of users or to everyone.
 If you want visibility restricted to a select group of users, provide a list of iPlant usernames.
 Public visibility means that any user will be able to launch the instance.

Welcome to AtmoDroid: The Android client for Atmosphere.
 
Before using this app you need:
 
* iPlant account 
* Access to atmosphere 
 
Use this app to:
 
* Login remotely to your Atmosphere account
 
* Get information about currently running instances.
 
* Request a running instance for use as an image.
 
* Create instances from Apps or Images
 
* Terminate running instances.
